citeinfo.title: Distribution Patterns of Urea in the Bering Sea and its Role in the Nitrogen Cycle

descript.abstract: Urea determination data along 5 sections in the Bering Sea perpendicular to the coastline show that the distribution of urea is similar to that of ammonium nitrogen. Accumulation of urea and ammonium was generally observed under the thermocline but the absolute concentration of urea was slightly higher. With the total urea and ammonium content of 7-10 mu g-at N/l in the euphotic layer, 8-10g C/m super(2) organic matter per day may be produced in the process of photosynthesis due to nitrogen recycling.
descript.purpose: To report on the distribution patterns of urea in the Bering Sea and its role in the nitrogen cycle.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system.
